text.p: Shares of Malayan Banking Bhd (Maybank) and Kwong Yik Bank Bhd have been suspended from trading on the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange pending an announcement.
Shares of Associated Kaolin Industries Bhd and Man Yau Holding Bhd have also been suspended.
The market has speculated that Maybank was selling off its interest in 75 percent-owned Kwong Yik, but it was not immediately clear if this was the reason for the suspensions.
Maybank managing director Amirsham Abdul Aziz said on Saturday the bank had no immediate plans to sell all or part of its stake in Kwong Yik.
Maybank shares were last traded at 25.00 ringgit and Kwong Yik at 6.95.
Shares of timber and refined kaolin firm Associated Kaolin were last traded at 13.10. Plastics parts manufacturer and property developer Man Yau shares last traded at 7.30.
